div.l: Ho HerkenythHerkenythHo herkenyth euere swich a ferly thyng
Ȝa þey schal haue þe flour of ille endyng
This longe nyȝt þ̉ere tydis me noreste
But ȝit no fors al schal ben for the beste
For Iohn seyde he as euere mote I thryue
Ȝif þᵗat I may þe wenche wele I schryue
Sūm esement has lawe I schapyn vs
For Iohn þ̉ere is a lawe þᵗat says þus
That ȝif a man in a poynt be a greuyd
That in a noþ̉er he schal ben releuyd
Oure corn is stolīn schortly it is non nay
And we han had an ille fit al þis day
And sȳn I schal hān non a mendement
A geyn my los I wele haue eysement
By godys sale it schal non oþ̉er be
This Iohn answerde Aley a vise þe
The mellere is a ꝑperlyous man he seyde
And ȝif þᵗat he out of hese slep a breyde
He myȝte vs don bothe a velanye
Alyn answerde I coıı̄unte hȳm not a flye
And vp he sterte ⁊and by þe wenche he crepte
This wenche lay vp ryght ⁊and faste slepte
Tyl he so nygh was er sche myghte aspye
That it hadde be to late for to crye
And schortely for to seyn þey were at on
Now pley aleyn for I wele speke of ion
This Iohn lyth stylle a furlong wey or too
And to hȳm self he makyth reuthe ⁊and woo
Allas ꝙquod he þis is a wekede iape
Now may I seyn þᵗat I is but an ape
Ȝit hath myn felawe sūmwhat for hese harm
He has þe melleris douȝtyr in hese arm
He aıı̄untered hȳm ⁊and has hese nedis sped
And I lye as a draf sek in myn bed
And whan þis iape is told a noþ̉er day
I schal ben told a daffe a cokenay
